# The `SCEVAddRecExpr` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

This node represents a polynomial recurrence on the trip count of the specified loop.

This is the primary focus of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> framework; all the other <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> subclasses are mostly just supporting infrastructure to allow <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr">SCEVAddRecExpr</a> expressions to be created and analyzed.

All operands of an AddRec are required to be loop invariant.

Definition at line 347 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### evaluateAtIteration() {#a33583576f220997d1c415df033559a57}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; SCEVAddRecExpr::evaluateAtIteration (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; It, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE) const</>}>
Return the value of this chain of recurrences at the specified iteration number.

We can evaluate this recurrence by multiplying each element in the chain by the binomial coefficient corresponding to it. In other words, we can evaluate &#123;A,+,B,+,C,+,D&#125; as:

A&#42;BC(It, 0) + B&#42;BC(It, 1) + C&#42;BC(It, 2) + D&#42;BC(It, 3)

where BC(It, k) stands for binomial coefficient.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l00989">989</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getNumIterationsInRange() {#a7e688afe102c3fa48ea49cb972a0f00c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; SCEVAddRecExpr::getNumIterationsInRange (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp; Range, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE) const</>}>
Return the number of iterations of this loop that produce values in the specified constant range.

Another way of looking at this is that it returns the first iteration number where the value is not in the condition, thus computing the exit count. If the iteration count can&#39;t be computed, an instance of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a> is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h/#l00410">410</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l13485">13485</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getStepRecurrence() {#a4049f7040a4628b15f182c3c9aaf802a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; llvm::SCEVAddRecExpr::getStepRecurrence (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Constructs and returns the recurrence indicating how much this expression steps by.

If this is a polynomial of degree N, it returns a chrec of degree N-1. We cannot determine whether the step recurrence has self-wraparound.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h/#l00365">365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isQuadratic() {#a5e91958e021e28eb6fbd30f76c96b731}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::SCEVAddRecExpr::isQuadratic () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if this represents an expression A + B&#42;x + C&#42;x^2 where A, B and C are loop invariant values.

This corresponds to an addrec of the form &#123;L,+,M,+,N&#125;

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h/#l00384">384</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>.

### setNoWrapFlags() {#a5316a2763777f3670c1606452f4e99d7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::SCEVAddRecExpr::setNoWrapFlags (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">NoWrapFlags</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set flags for a recurrence without clearing any previously set flags.

For AddRec, either NUW or NSW implies NW. Keep track of this fact here to make it easier to propagate flags.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h/#l00389">389</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>.
